content.description: Stand start on edges and make a move with your right hand to a small flake. Throw the left for a small edge then fire for the top.
content.location: To the right of Bark Mulch

content.description: Sit start off of rock on a left hand pinch and right hand side pull.  Make a series of moves up crimps to the top.  There may be a lower sit to this.
Sit start under roof on crimps.  Make a big move to a good edge then follow edges to the top.
content.location: Coming up from route 16 this is on the back left corner.

content.description: Stand start, left hand on a weird grip that can be held a few ways, at around head height. Right hand on an awful sloped crimp out right. Figure out some feet and make a big move, on horrible feet, to the horizontal. Get established again and climb the shallow, vertical crack with knobs and slopers to the top. Beta intensive.
content.protection: Two pads. The landing is pretty good and soft. I took the worst fall possible from the top, missed the pads and walked away. A spotter might be nice.

content.description: Sit start right hand crimp and left hand on creaky flake.  Make a move out right to a good edge then follow edges up and left to a heady top out.
content.location: From 16 this is on the right/front side of the boulder.

content.description: Cool block with some room for more problems.  You can see this rock from route 16. I believe there is a bobcat or fox living under this boulder.
